etymology.description: 𠃊 (graphic sign symbolizing something hidden) ->匸 (depicts a box or container that hides something)
etymology.interpretation: The character 匸(xì, 'box') is a pictogram representing a container used to conceal something. The form aligns with its purpose of symbolizing concealment.

examples.chinese: 我在匸(匸)中发现了一枚古钱(我在匸(匸)中發現了一枚古錢)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zài xì zhōng fāxiànle yī méi gǔqián.
examples.english: I discovered an ancient coin in the box.

examples.chinese: 他用匸(匸)装载宝物(他用匸(匸)裝載寶物)，悄悄把它藏起来(悄悄把它藏起來)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng xì zhuāngzài bǎowù, qiāoqiāo bǎ tā cángqǐlái.
examples.english: He used the box to store treasures and secretly hid them.
